oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Disposition Kinetics of Intravenously Administered Caffeine in Dogs with Acute Liver Disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Boothe, Dawn Merton
Jenkins, W. L.
Brown, Scott A.
Weise, Dale
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: caffeine
dogs
hepatic necrosis
graduate research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Disposition kinetics of intravenously administered caffeine (20mg/kg) were compared between 6 control beagle dogs and 6 beagle dogs with acute liver disease. Following pretreatment evaluation, acute hepatic necrosis was induced by the oral administration of dimethylnitrosamine (DMNA), a liver specific toxin.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 125
